docblock.long-description: User: Matt Date: 20/04/2016 Time: 2:32 PM

docblock.description: Class for interacting with the Freshdesk Api
docblock.long-description: This is the only class that should be instantiated directly. All API resources are available via the relevant public properties
User: Matt

Thrown when the Freshdesk API returns a 403 error code. This indicates that the agent whose credentials were used in making this request was not authorized to perform this API call. It could be that this API call requires admin level credentials or perhaps the Freshdesk portal doesn't have corresponding feature enabled. It could also indicate that the user has reached the maximum number of failed login attempts or that the account has reached the maximum number of agents
A Guzzle Request Exception is returned
User: Matt
Thrown when the Freshdesk API returns an HTTP error code that isn't handled by other exceptions
A Guzzle Request Exception is returned
User: Matt
Thrown when the Freshdesk API returns a 401 error, which indicates that the Authorization header is either missing or incorrect
A Guzzle Request Exception is returned
User: Matt

Thrown when the Freshdesk API returns a 409 code. The resource that is being created/updated is in an inconsistent or conflicting state. For example, if you attempt to Create a Contact with an email that is already associated with an existing user, this code will be returned
A Guzzle Request Exception is returned
User: Matt Date: 20/04/2016 Time: 12:09 PM
This indicates that the API was not initialized correctly
User: Matt

Thrown when the Freshdesk API returns a 405 code. This API request used the wrong HTTP verb/method. For example an API PUT request on /api/v2/tickets endpoint will return a HTTP 405 as /api/v2/tickets allows only GET and POST requests
A Guzzle Request Exception is returned
User: Matt

Thrown when the Freshdesk API returns a 404 code. This is returned when the request contains invalid ID/Freshdesk domain in the URL or an invalid URL itself. For example, an API call to retrieve a ticket with an invalid ID will return a HTTP 404 status code to let you know that no such ticket exists
A Guzzle Request Exception is returned
User: Matt
Thrown when a the Freshdesk API returns a 429 code. The API rate limit alloted for your Freshdesk domain has been exhausted
A Guzzle Request Exception is returned
User: Matt
Thrown when the Freshdesk API returns a 406 code. Only application/json and '*\/*' are supported. When uploading files multipart/form-data is supported
A Guzzle Request Exception is returned
User: Matt
Thrown when the Freshdesk API returns a 415 code. Content type application/xml is not supported. Only application/json is supported
A Guzzle Request Exception is returned
User: Matt

Thrown when the Freshdesk API returns a 400 code. This means the request body/query string is not in the correct format. For example, the Create a ticket API requires the requester_id field to be sent as part of the request and if it is missing, this status code is returned
A Guzzle Request Exception is returned
User: Matthew Date: 21/04/2016 Time: 8:20 AM
Abstract class which all resources inherit from
User: Matt Date: 20/04/2016 Time: 2:32 PM
This provides access to the agent resources

docblock.description: Get a list of all agents.
docblock.long-description: Use filters ($query) to view only specific resources (those which match the criteria that you choose).
Create a resource with the supplied data

Use 'include' to embed additional details in the response. Each include will consume an additional credit. For example if you embed the requester and company information you will be charged a total of 3 API credits for the call. See Freshdesk's documentation for details.

Provides access to the contact resources
The agent whose credentials (API key or username/password) are being used to make this API call should be authorised to view the contact fields

docblock.description: Convert a contact into an agent
docblock.long-description: Note: 1. The contact must have an email address in order to be converted into an agent. 2. If your account has already reached the maximum number of agents, the API request will fail with HTTP error code 403 3. The agent whose credentials (API key, username and password) were used to make this API call should be authorised to convert a contact into an agent
